subject: Business
title: Stocks: Owning a Piece of a Company
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Stocks: Owning a Piece of a Company.

hook.text: Buy one share of Apple and you legally own a tiny fraction of a $3 trillion company. You're a part-owner.

buildup.text: A stock represents ownership in a company. Its price reflects what investors believe the company is worth.

discovery.text: Stockholders profit two ways: the price rising (capital gains) and dividends (share of profits paid to owners).

twist.text: Stock prices reflect expectations, not reality. A profitable company can have a falling stock if expectations drop.

climax.text: The S&P 500 has averaged about 10% annual returns since 1926, making stocks the best long-term wealth builder.

punchline.text: Buy ownership in great companies. Let time do the work.

quiz.question: What does owning a stock represent?
